comments:
build i028-0800, winxp, j9sc20031212

I was running Eclipse and got an out of memory exception which the UI caught and
asked me if I wanted to exit. I said yes so Eclipse shut down. During the shut
down process I was prompted with the following dialog: "A problem has occurred
during startup, please check your .log file...."

huh?

Isn't this one of the messages produced by the native launcher? Maybe we are not
returning the right exit code.

Yep. Code description should be somewhere in Main.java. I think that I made it
"lucky 13" to indicate an error.

Is there a message that says "look in your .log file" without mentioning
"startup" (or even better, mentioning "shutdown")?

BTW, did you remember if there was actually an error in the log file related to
shutting down?

This is the full contents of the log file from the workspace/.metadata area:

!SESSION ----------------------------------------------------------------------
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 Jan 29, 2004 10:42:09.792
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError

Here are the contents of the config dir log file:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.jdt.ui 4 4 Jan 29, 2004 10:38:47.331
!MESSAGE Unknown method: canDelete
!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 4 Jan 29, 2004 10:41:55.842
!MESSAGE Unhandled event loop exception
!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 Jan 29, 2004 10:41:55.852
!MESSAGE java.lang.OutOfMemoryError
!STACK 0
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError

The launcher (Main.java) catches any throwable coming from the EclipseStarter
(in this case, an OutOfMemory error) and exits the VM with exit code 13. So, I
think if there is no other message, we should change the existing one to say
something less specific, such as "A problem has occurred, please check your .log
file...".

Comments?

looks like htere is a bug in the config log copy code.  Looks like the file was 
not flushed before being copied.
 
If this was the error that caused you to crash then perhaps at some point going 
down the instance location was set and caused the copy.  Perhaps the copy 
failed because of the out of memory...

comment 5.  should consult with UI folks to see what we can do.  Some people 
already think that the current message is too vague.  It would be cool to check 
the osgi.instance.area system property.  If it is set, we can point them 
directly at the file.  If it is not set, point them directly at the .config log 
location.  That way we don't have to describe two logs etc.  We just point 
people directly where to look.

It would be cool if we could tell people where the log file is.
See bug 33974.
Sounds like it's a job for our friends the system properties.

environment properties perhaps.  System properties will be lost when the VM 
exits.
moving to Pascal for verification that his recent fixes addressed this problem

Owing to the new try catch block in eclipseStarter, this error should be logged
properly. Moreover if the support is the eclipse.exe, the user will be able to
have a message tell him where the log is.
